paper.title: Resource requirements for the application of addition chains in modulo exponentiation

paper.venue: Theory and Application of Cryptographic Techniques
paper.abstract: Addition chains or sequences can be usecd to reduce the amount of multiplications to accomplish an exponentiation at the cost of more memory required. We examine known methods of exponentiations based on addition sequences and derive the parameters determining operation count and number of required registers for storing intermediate results. As a result an improved method is proposed to choose window distributions as a basis for using known addition sequence heuristics.
